alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 9:11PM CDT until March 27 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Illinois River near Tahlequah affecting Cherokee County. Illinois River at Chewey affecting Adair, Cherokee and Delaware Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River near Tahlequah. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs from Hanging Rock downstream towards Tahlequah. Access roads east of the Combs Bridge near Eagles Bluff are impassable. Some cabins and parks may begin to flood. Extreme turbulence makes the river too hazardous for floating. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 14.8 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
